subject: Public Speaking
title: The Mere Exposure Effect
description: A 60-second lesson on The Mere Exposure Effect.

hook.text: Repeated exposure to ideas makes them more acceptable.

buildup.text: This is why consistent messaging eventually wins.

discovery.text: Audiences don't need to agree immediately. Familiarity breeds comfort.

twist.text: Politicians repeat talking points because repetition changes minds.

climax.text: Don't expect one speech to change everything. Stay consistent.
